Basic details: Michael Johnson, a 52-year-old male, comes to the ED complaining of chest pain.
Vitals:
BP: 150/95 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 20/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit upright and clutch your chest occasionally.
Show signs of discomfort and anxiety.
Breathe shallowly and occasionally wince in pain.
If the examinee mentions a stress test, ask, "What is a stress test?"
Challenging question: "Could this be something other than a heart attack? What else could it be?"
